key_title: Key to the species of Urtica

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Urtica
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Urtica. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Mature leaves and stems glabrous or nearly so between the stinging hairs, larger perianth lobes of flowers not entirely covered with hairs; leaves at least somewhat discolorous; annual or perennial
Leaves, stems and flowers all markedly pubescent between longer, scattered stinging hairs; leaves more or less concolorous; perennial
Leaves with lamina to 13 cm long, with margins broadly toothed; perennial; larger perianth lobes of female flowers glabrous
Leaves with lamina to 5 cm long, ovate to elliptic, with margins deeply and narrowly toothed; annual; larger perianth lobes of female flowers fringed with curved hairs
